chunk: flagship events: mr and ms bitotsav, dance saga, abhinay, battle of bands, squid games
When: Date for bitotsav: 21st March to 23rd March
Where: Bitotsav will be held in the Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra campus

event name: dance saga, club name: dance club, category: flagship, prize: 15k, timing:, venue: gp birla auditorium, 
faculty advisor: mrs. alka srivastav, prize:, description: "if you stumble, make it a part of the dance." 
wavy steps, lacy moves, and graceful expressions when all these occur in unison, the result is angelic! 
dance is an art that comes straight from the heart. so, get ready to enthrall the audience as bitotsav 
'25 brings to you its flagship event dance saga! get set to let yourself loose as your energy rattles the 
stage. bring your group and stand a chance to win exciting cash prizes., rules and regulations: this is a 
group dance compeɵtion that will be held on the main campus of bit mesra, ranchi.  team size: 6-20.  
ɵme limit: 4-8 minutes.  a minimum of 6 dancers are required to be present on the stage throughout 
the performance.  the dance groups are required to send a video entry of not more than 5 minutes 
from their performance along with details (names of members, college name, props being used). the 
video size should not be more than 50 mb.  mulɵple teams from the same college are permitted.  props 
involving fire, water, and powdered substances (like talcum powder/holi colour/rangoli colour, etc.) 
are strictly prohibited.  song tracks should not contain any explicit or offensive words. failure to comply 
with this will lead to immediate disqualification.  the auditorium screen shall not be used for any 
purpose (photos, videos, etc.).  teams are not allowed to use any external lighɵng or live music for 
their performance.  any mess created on stage or in the green room must be cleaned by the team 
itself; therefore, it is advised to be careful with items such as alta/body paint etc.  there will only be 
one round, and the result will be declared at the end of all the performances.  the decision of the 
judges will be final and binding. judgement criteria:  choreography, expressions, energy level, 
presentation, costumes and props, innovation, and overall impact. o incase of conflicts, the decision 
of the judges would be considered final.  there will be 2 winners- ist & 2nd., contact information: laksh-
7970817208, resources required: * pen * paper * chairs * table * sheets pa system

event name: footloose, club name: dance club, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty 
advisor: mrs. alka srivastav, prize:, description: dancers set the stage on fire with their smooth moves 
and rhythm. every move is an expression of emotion. through their capɵvaɵng performances, which 
feature both exquisite pirouettes and forceful leaps, they tell tales. cheers take on a rhythm of their 
own, reflecɵng the appreciation of the crowd. in the sɵllness, dancers commune with their innermost 
selves, a communion of souls. they depict tenacity and inventiveness with every louɵsh and twirl. 
dreams soar and souls dance unrestrained in this celebration of the limitless manifestation of the 
human spirit, rules and regulations:  this is a solo dance event.  the parɵcipants are required to get 
their soundtracks in a pen drive. the songs should not contain any explicit or offensive words. failure 
to comply with this will lead to immediate disqualification.  props involving fire, water, and powdered 
substances (like talcum powder/holi colour/rangoli colour, etc) are strictly prohibited.  the parɵcipants 
selected from the online round are required to report to bit mesra, ranchi, main campus for further 
rounds.  mulɵple parɵcipants from the same college are permitted.  the parɵcipants are required to 
get their soundtracks in a pen drive. the songs should not contain any explicit or offensive words. 
failure to comply with this will lead to immediate disqualification. there will be 2 rounds for this event 
name: round i: solo performance  ɵme limit- 3 minutes  the parɵcipants are required to get their own 
soundtracks.  based on the performance, 4 parɵcipants will be shortlisted for the second round. e the 
decision of the judges will be final and binding. round 2: face-off  the shortlisted parɵcipants will have 
to compete against each other on a random song selected by the judge on the spot.  each parɵcipant 
will have the turn to perform.  the decision of the judges will be final and binding.  there will be 3 
winners- ist, 2" and 3rd, contact information: reetika tiwary-7061207063 ayushi purty-9630526027, 
resources required: * table * chairs * pen * sheets * pa system

event name: koun banega collector, club name: naps, category: formal/informal:, timing:, venue:, 
faculty advisor: mrinal pathak, prize:, description: mission upsc: the simulation is a unique event 
designed to replicate the upsc selection process, giving parɵcipants a real-ɵme experience of the 
presɵgious exam. this event aims to provide a realisɵc and challenging upsc selection experience, 
helping parɵcipants idenɵfy their strengths, improve their analyɵcal skills, and enhance their ability to 
handle complex situations under pressure., rules and regulations: general rules: |. the event is open 
to all interested parɵcipants. 2. parɵcipants must register before the deadline to be eligible. 3. any 
form of cheaɵng, misconduct, or unfair advantage will lead to immediate disqualification. 4. the 
decision of the judges and organizers will be final and binding. preliminary quiz round (mcq test) |. the 
quiz will consist of mulɵple-choice questions on general knowledge, current affairs, and apɵtude. 2. 
each parɵcipant must complete the quiz within the given ɵme limit. 3. use of mobile phones, books, 
or any external help is strictly prohibited. 4. only the top-scoring parɵcipants will qualify for the 
interview round. interview round |. parɵcipants will be interviewed by a panel of judges. 2. the 
interview will assess ethical reasoning, confidence, problem-solving, and communication skills. 3. ɵme 
limits for each parɵcipant will be strictly followed. 4. parɵcipants should maintain formal conduct and 
professional behavior., contact information: nidhi-6392639105, resources required: * paper * pen

event name: beyond the screen - the press conference, club name: naps, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, 
faculty advisor: mrinal pathak, prize:, description: the news and publication society presents beyond 
the screen: the press conference, an exciting and immersive event where parɵcipants will step into the 
shoes of journalists covering high stakes press conferences in a fictional world. fictional worlds to 
explore: |. friends — dive into ross and rachel’s legendary “we were on a break” debate. 2. taarak 
mehta ka ooltah chashma — interact with the gokul dham society members and uncover their daily 
dilemmas. 3. money heist — challenge the professor and his crew on their master heist strategies., 
rules and regulations: general rules: i. the event is open to all interested parɵcipants, either as 
individuals or in teams (team size to be specified). 2. parɵcipants must register before the deadline to 
be eligible for the compeɵtion. 3. any form of misconduct, including inappropriate language or 
behavior, will lead to disqualification. 4. the decision of the judges and organizers will be final and 
binding on all matters. round i: the quiz challenge |. the quiz will consist of mulɵple-choice and short-
answer questions based on the selected fictional worlds. 2. parɵcipants will have a limited ɵme to 
answer each question. 3. use of the internet, books, or any external help is prohibited. 4. the top-
scoring parɵcipants/teams will advance to round 2. round 2: the press conference i. finalists will be 
assigned a fictional world and characters for questioning. 2. parɵcipants must frame their questions 
based on events and character actions within the selected universe. 3. judges will assess the quality, 
depth, and originality of questions. 4. any off-topic or irrelevant questions will not be considered. 5. 
ɵme limits must be strictly followed for both questioning and responses., contact information: alisha-
763284797, resources required: * projector and screen * paper * pen

event name: circuit chase, club name: ecesoc, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty 
advisor: dr. ss tripathy, prize:, description: phase |: quick-fire tech quiz (earn components) |. the host 
asks ece-related questions 2.the first team to answer correctly wins a circuit component for their 
project. 3. wrong answers = penalty (skip next question). 4.faster answers = more components = easier 
circuit building! phase 2: circuit race (build & troubleshoot) |.teams race to complete a working circuit 
using  the  components  they  earned.  the  host  may  introduce  random  “power  cuts”  or  faulty 
components to make it challenge! the first team to successfully complete their circuit wins the round., 
rules and regulations: |.divided into 3-5 member in a teams 2.each team gets a station with a mini-

circuit setup. 3. the team that completes their circuit first wins! 4. bonus points for creaɵvity (if they 
modify or improve the circuit)., contact information: ishaan: 6202998647 pratham:7207105737, 
resources required: « simple circuit components — 100 leds, 100 resistors, 30 switches, 50 batteries, 
|50 connecɵng wires, 30 breadboards. * a whiteboard or ɵmer for tracking points * question cards 
with ece-related puzzles, riddles, and circuit problems. * 60 pens and 30 white papers

event name: electronics bingo, club name: ecesoc, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor: dr. ss 
tripathy, prize:, description: distribute bingo cards: give each player a bingo card. explain the rules: 
briefly explain the rules and objectives of the game. start the game: the caller starts calling out 
electronics-related terms or images from the prepared list. mark off terms: players mark off the called 
terms or images on their bingo cards. get five in a row: the first player to get five correct marks in a 
row (horizontally, verɵcally, or diagonally) calls out bingo and wins. verify the win: the caller verifies 
the winning player's bingo card to ensure they have indeed gotten five correct marks in a row., contact 
information: ishaan: 6202998647 pratham:7207105737, resources required: * bingo cards: create 
bingo cards with a grid of squares, each containing an electronics related term or image (e.g., resistor, 
capacitor, microcontroller, led, etc) * caller's list: list of electronics-related terms or images that 
correspond to the ones on the bingo cards. * 60 markers: provide markers or chips for players to mark 
off the called terms or images on their bingo cards * 60 white pages

event name: electric monopoly, club name: ecesoc, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor: dr. ss 
tripathy, prize:, description: basically, a monopoly in terms of electronics such as like, jail can be termed 
as power cut and so and so. it will have point for each purpose first one to reach the end wins the 
game, contact information: ishaan: 6202998647 pratham:7207105737, resources required: * caller's 
list: list of electronics-related terms or images that correspond to the game purpose * 60 pens * 60 
white pages

event name: skyfall scramble, club name: aerosoc, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor:, prize:, 
description: i.in this event, parɵcipants will drop an egg with a parachute. 2. the goal is to ensure the 
egg survives the fall, tesɵng both the effectiveness of the parachute and the parɵcipants' ability to 
design a safe landing system, contact information:, resources required: * polybag * strings * glue *

event name: right simulation, club name: aerosoc, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor:, prize:, 
description: 1. in this event, parɵcipants get the opportunity to step into a flight simulator, where they 
can try piloɵng an aircraō 2. they can simulate take off, navigation, and landing, giving them a taste of 
what it's like to fly a plane, contact information:, resources required: * polybag « strings * glue * double

event name: business crisis simulation, club name: 180dc, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor: 
dr. anupam ghosh, prize:, description: step into the role of elite business consultants! parɵcipants will 
be presented with a high-stakes corporate crisis—ranging from pr disasters to financial downturns. 
their task is to develop a rapid yet effective strategy to miɵgate the crisis, stabilize the company, and 

ensure long-term recovery. team size: 3 to 4 members per team 1. crisis briefing (15 mins) each team 
receives a randomly assigned crisis scenario (e.g., financial distress, product recall, data breach). 
relevant background materials and hints will be provided. 2. solution development (30 mins) teams 
must develop a strategic action plan addressing the crisis. solutions must be feasible, considering 
corporate constraints and stakeholder impact. 3. presentation & defense (15 mins) each team presents 
a 5-minute solution to a panel of judges acɵng as company executives. judges will challenge their 
approach with counter-questions to assess adaptability., rules and regulations: |. realism & feasibility: 
solutions must be pracɵcal and executable in a real-world corporate seƫng. 2. originality & criɵcal 
thinking:  copying  exisɵng  case  study  solutions  without  adaptation  will  result  in  penalɵes.  3. 
presentation guidelines: each team has 5 minutes to present, followed by a 5-minute q&a session. 4. 
ɵme management: exceeding the allotted ɵme in any stage will result in point deductions. 5. winner 
selection the top-scoring team wins, with special mentions for: best strategic response most innovative solution, contact information: amar : 7782951149, resources required: * 50 pens * 50 sheets

event name: time traveller consultant, club name: 180dc, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor: 
dr. anupam ghosh, prize:, description: step into the shoes of a historical strategist! parɵcipants will be 
transported to a randomly assigned historical era—be it the roman empire, mughal age, or industrial 
revolution—and will act as consultants to the ruler of that ɵme. their mission: to formulate innovative 
strategies to enhance the empire’s trade, economy, and military strength using their knowledge of 
modernday advancements while ensuring historical accuracy. team size: | to 3 members per team ɵme 
limit: 3 hours (inclusive of research, strategy formulation, and presentation) event structure i. era 
allocation (15 mins) each team will receive a random historical ɵmeline to consult on. background 
materials and hints will be provided. 2. strategy formulation (2 hrs) teams must develop a detailed 
trade and military expansion plan. they must ensure feasibility within the technological and poliɵcal 
constraints of their era. 3. presentation & defense (45 mins) teams will present their strategies to a 
panel of judges, acɵng as historical rulers. judges may ask counter-questions to test their reasoning 
and adaptability., rules and regulations: i. adherence to historical context: proposals must align with 
the era's technological and societal constraints. unfounded or anachronisɵc advancements (e.g., 
airplanes in the mughal era) will lead to penalɵes. 2. originality & criɵcal thinking: copying exisɵng 
case study solutions without adaptation will result in penalɵes. 3. presentation guidelines: each team 
has 5 minutes to present, followed by a 5-minute q&a session. visual aids (charts, diagrams) are 
encouraged but must be prepared within the event ɵmeframe. 4. ɵme management: exceeding the 
allotted ɵme in any stage will result in point deductions. 5. winner selection the top-scoring team wins, 
with special mentions for best military strategy and best trade strategy., contact information: amar : 7782951149, resources required: * 50 pens * 50 sheets

event name: bytehunt, club name: eeesoc, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor: dr. shiva kumar, 
prize:, description: this is a two-round event designed to challenge parɵcipants with speed and 
problem-solving abiliɵes. this event mainly consists of two rounds, f first one is the rapid-fire quiz, and 
the second one is the treasure hunt, rules and regulations: roundi:  teams will compete head-to-head 
to answer questions on the spot.  topéteams will be selected for the next round. total ɵme duration 
for this round will be |-2 hours. round2:  this round will be based on treasure hunt in which all the 
teams have to solve riddles and navigate through four different locations.  total ɵme duration for this 
round will be 2-3 hours., contact information: vasundhara arya- 997325134 lucky kr.- 7544063758, 
resources required: * arduino compaɵble number pad rs 60 per piece- 4 pc « led light- iset rs 50 per 

set * arduino uno 350 per set- 4 * jumper wire- 2 set 100 per set « battery 9v- 4 20 per set * pen and 
paper- 100 each * cardboard 4 * chart paper- a2 5 black chart paper *2 tape

event name: where in bit?, club name: ieee, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor: dr. aōab alam, 
prize:, description: the parɵcipants will be shown a picture from someplace in bit. then the parɵcipants 
will have to find the place on google maps and submit the respective coordinates on the google forms 
link provided by the organizers in each ɵme frame., rules and regulations: a team of two will be formed. 
the parɵcipants will be awarded points proportional to the accuracy of the coordinates. the team with 
the highest points wins. parɵcipants need to bring their own laptops, contact information: akash 
kumar tiwary -7070489408

event name: pitstop pursuit, club name: srijan, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor: mr. somak 
datta, prize:, description: compete in a high-stakes auction and race your way to victory! in the first 
round, teams will bid on essenɵal car components like engines, ɵres, aerodynamics, and nitro boosts 
using limited virtual points. strategic bidding is key, overspending on one part may weaken others. the 
top teams with the highest total points will qualify for the next round. in the final phase, the top five 
teams will enter a racing simulation, where their chosen setup will determine their lap ɵme. the fastest 
lap wins, with prizes for the top three teams. think smart, bid wisely, and race to glory!, rules and 
regulations: this is a group dance compeɵtion that will be held on the main campus of bit mesra, 
ranchi. team size: 4-5. o if a bid remains uncontested for more than 15 seconds, the component will 
be sold to the team that placed the last bid. round i: auction rules each team will receive a fixed 
number of virtual points to bid on car components. bidding will be conducted in real-ɵme, and teams 
must place their bids within the given ɵme limit. teams cannot exceed their total points while bidding. 
each component has a pre-assigned value, and once sold, it cannot be rebid. the top teams with the 
highest total points will qualify for the next round. round 2: racing simulation rules teams will compete 
using their acquired components from the auction; no modifications allowed. performance in the race 
will depend on engine power, ɵre grip, aerodynamics, and nitro boosts. each team will get one official 
race attempt, and the fastest lap ɵme will determine the winners. |n case of a ɵe, the team with the 
best engine performance will be given priority. only the team with the fastest lap ɵme will be crowned 
the winner, contact information: ayush nigam-9305891636, resources required: * paper * pen

event name: mismatched, club name: leo, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor: dr. amit saran, 
prize:, description: round i: telepathy test team members attempt to match their choices without 
direct communication. pairs are placed in separate rooms and presented with a series of prompts 
requiring them to predict their partner’s response. points are awarded for correct matches, and the 
top teams move to the next round. round 2: draw relay one player is given a word or object to draw. 
instead of using paper, they sketch it on the back of their teammate. the second player, based on the 
sensation, attempts to replicate the drawing on a provided sheet or board. the team that produces the 
most accurate drawings within the ɵme limit moves to the next round. round 3: synergy quest one 
person from the team will be locked to a chair, while the other member will be blindfolded. the locked 
parɵcipant must guide their blindfolded teammate to complete a given task and retrieve the key to 
unlock them. the team that completes the challenge in the shortest ɵme wins., rules and regulations: 
note: in case of any discrepancies or disputes, the decision of the organizing team will be final, abiding, 
and indisputable. disclaimer: the event will be conducted in three rounds, and only the top teams from 

each round will proceed further. general event flow: o all shortlisted teams, with a maximum of two 
members each, must assemble at the designated venue.  team leaders must report at least 30 minutes 
before the event for verification at the helpdesk.  only the team leader needs to line up for this 
process.  team leaders are responsible for ensuring all team members are present at the venue. 
volunteers may verify the members' presence.  teams will be served on a first-come, first-served basis. 
please be paɵent and cooperative with our volunteers.  before each round begins, parɵcipants must 
provide the names of the individuals represenɵng their team for that specific round at the verification 
desk. o in case of any discrepancies or disputes, the decision of the organizing team will be final, 
abiding, and indisputable.  the organizing team reserves the right to disqualify any team engaging in 
malpracɵce.  use of mobile phones and smartwatches is not allowed during the event. o if you have 
any questions, please do not hesitate to contact the organizers., contact information: shubham kumar- 
6200926298 khushi sharma-9137128115, resources required: « paper-200 * pen-150 * chalk-1 box * 
projector-2 * chain-5 * chain lock and key-5 * cups-100

event name: takeshi's castle, club name: leo, category: formal/informal, timing:, venue:, faculty advisor: dr. amit saran, 
prize:, description: round |: one way out one member from each team will choose one of the three 
doors based on a given clue. only the correct door will lead to the next round while the other two will 
be blocked. round 2: sync and sprint players from each team will be given shape cards. they must form 
shape-based groups matching the displayed number and rush to an assigned stop. those leō without 
a group when the music stops will be eliminated. round 3: roll to win parɵcipants will lie flat on 
skateboards and propel themselves forward using their hands, aiming to stop as close to the finish line 
as possible without crossing it. those nearest to the line will advance to the next stage. round 4: blind 
quest one blindfolded player from each team will have to navigate a maze, guided solely by verbal 
instructions from their teammate outside the maze. the player compleɵng the maze in the shortest 
ɵme will secure victory., rules and regulations: note: in case of any discrepancies or disputes, the 
decision of the organizing team will be final, abiding, and indisputable. disclaimer: this event is based 
on the show takeshi’s castle and consists of 4 mulɵple rounds. general event flow:  all shortlisted teams 
(consisɵng of 4 players in each team) must assemble at the designated venue.  team leaders are 
required to report at least 30 minutes prior to the event's commencement for verification at the 
helpdesk.  only the team leader needs to line up for the verification process.  team leaders are 
responsible for ensuring all team members are present at the event. volunteers may verify the 
members' presence.  teams will be served on a first-come, first-served basis. please be paɵent and 
cooperative with our volunteers. e a team member cannot parɵcipate in consecutive rounds.  before 
each round begins, parɵcipants must provide the names of the individuals represenɵng their team for 
that specific round at the verification desk.  the organizing team reserves the right to disqualify any 
team engaging in malpracɵce.  the decision of the organizing team is final, abiding and indisputable 
for any discrepancies or disputes., contact information: shubham kumar — 6200926298 khushi sharma 
- 9137128115, resources required: * pa system * cartoons-60 * skateboard-5 * playing cards-4 * 
blindfolds-12 * electric tapes (red colour)-40 * measuring tape-2 * markers-10 * pencils-12 * ropes-2 
* chart papers-25 * black wall paint * paint brush

event name: mr and ms bitotsav, category: flagship, round 1: (online) we will organise an online 
questionnaire round and parɵcipants will be shortlisted based on their confidence, speaking skills and 
presence of mind. round 2: 15 girls and 15 boys will be shortlisted from round 1. introduction + first 
impression, each contestant will get 30-60 seconds to introduce themselves. round 3: top 5 boys & 5 
girls from round 2 will qualify for the final round. then they have to perform ramp walk and answer 
the questions asked by the judges, rules and regulations: round one: 1. parɵcipants must submit an 
entry photograph of themselves. 2. entries must be sent to [socialmediahandle]. 3. obscenity in 
photographs or taglines will result in immediate disqualification. 4. the photograph should be high 
quality and full-length (no selfies). 5. parɵcipants must share their bitotsav’25 entry photo to gain likes 
& reach. 6. entries will be judged based on social media outreach & content (photograph + tagline). 7. 
the judges’ decision is final and binding., rules and regulations: round two: • 15 girls and 15 boys will 
be shortlisted from round 1. • contestants must be present at bit mesra, main campus for rehearsals. 
• elimination round – parɵcipants will perform a ramp walk, and judges will rate them. round three: • 
top 5 boys & 5 girls from round 2 will qualify for the final round. • the final event will have three sub-
rounds tesɵng: • ramp walk • posture & final pose, rules and regulations: contact information: • 
costume, makeup, accessories, and hairdo • parɵcipants must also answer a judges’ questionnaire. let 
the battle for mr. & ms. bitotsav 2025 begin! debjyoti: 9341822684 Aashish Ranjan: 9262815123, faculty advisor: Dr.Sujeet Mishra

event name: battle of bands, club name: dhwani, prize: 15k, faculty advisor: mrinal pathak, category: flagship, the band that scores the highest points in band 
ɵghtness, overall stage presentation, and music composition wins. | rules and regulations : 1. ɵme

quality, and overall output of the performance. 8. decision of the judges will remain final and binding. 
contact information: adarsh- 6202172061 ramendra– 9570245195

event name: abhinay, category: flagship, prize: 15k, club name: ehsaas dramatics society,  abhinay is an exciting stage play event. prepare to be 
enthralled by an extraordinary stage play that promises to dazzle and inspire! this capɵvaɵng event 
showcases a dynamic performance brimming with vivid storytelling, stunning visuals, and hearƞelt 
emotion. talented actors bring a compelling narrative to life, weaving together moments of drama, 
humor, and triumph on a beauɵfully craōed stage. with dazzling costumes, immersive sets, and a 
powerful soundtrack, every detail is designed to transport you into the heart of the story. whether 
you’re a theater enthusiast or a first-ɵme attendee, this unforgettable production will leave you 
spellbound. don’t miss this magical celebration of creaɵvity and arɵstry! | rules and regulations : - the 
event is open to teams with a size of 10-15 members. - each team must register prior to the event 
deadline. - teams must provide a list of parɵcipants and their roles in the play. - the play must be 
original or properly credited if based on exisɵng works. - the use of any offensive, discriminatory, or 
inappropriate content is strictly prohibited. - each performance must be between 25 to 30 minutes. |

event name: jumanji 3.o, category: formal/informal, jumanji 3.0 is an exciting and engaging event that will showcase the 
parɵcipant’s team spirit, creaɵvity and coordination. this event is designed into different subparts to 
test parɵcipant’s problem-solving skills, speed, accuracy, balance, focus and their teamwork. | 1. 
treasure hunt event format: • parɵcipants form teams (usually 2-4 members). • each team receives an 
iniɵal clue leading to the next location. • clues can involve puzzles, ciphers, riddles, or physical 
challenges. • teams must solve each clue to advance to the next stage. • the final clue leads to the 
hidden treasure/reward. | rules and regulations : teams must follow the clue order. no external help 
(phones, internet) unless specified. the first team to find the treasure wins. | 2. lemon & spoon race 
event format: • each parɵcipant gets a spoon and a lemon (or table tennis ball). • the lemon is placed 
on the spoon, which must be held in the mouth or hand (as per event rules) • parɵcipants must walk 
or run towards the finish line without dropping the lemon. • if the lemon falls, the parɵcipant may 
need to restart from a checkpoint or the beginning, based on the rules. | rules and regulations : no 
touching the lemon with hands aōer the race starts. if the lemon falls, the parɵcipant must restart (as 
per rules). fair play and sportsmanship must be followed | 3. breach of trust event format: • each team 
consists of two players. • players must place a balloon between them (at the back, or forehead as per 
the rules). • they must walk or run towards the finish line without touching or dropping the balloon. • 
if the balloon falls, the team must restart from a checkpoint or the beginning (as per event rules). | 
rules and regulations : no touching the balloon with hands aōer the race starts. if the balloon falls, the 
team must restart from the designated point. teams must move together in sync without bursɵng the 
balloon | 4. puzzle pursuit event format: • teams are given a disassembled puzzle with its pieces 
scattered on a table. • the objective is to correctly assemble the puzzle within the given ɵme limit. • 
the team that completes the puzzle the fastest or with the most pieces correctly placed wins | rules 
and regulations : teams cannot take pieces o the table or hide them. only hand movements are 
allowed—no external tools or force should be used. teams must work together and communicate 
effectively to complete the puzzle. if a team misplaces a piece incorrectly, they must fix it before 
proceeding further | 5. pyramid blitz event format: • each parɵcipant competes individually. • players 
must first build a pyramid using paper cups. • once the pyramid is built, they must knock it down using 
a sponge ball. • the process is repeated as many ɵmes as possible within the given ɵme limit. • the 

player who completes the highest number of build-and smash cycles wins. | rules and regulations : 
players must build the pyramid in the correct formation before smashing it. the ball must be thrown 
from a designated spot—no touching the cups to knock them over. if the pyramid is not properly built, 
the smash attempt does not count. in case of a ɵe, the fastest single build-and-smash round will 
determine the winner. contact information : md raja istekhar : +916204185245 naman khatwani : +91 
78800 36191

event name: tug of torque, welcome to "tug of torque", where raw strength meets teamwork in the 
ulɵmate battle of endurance! but here’s the catch—our atv weighs just 180kg, lighter than a royal 
enfield bike, yet pulling it won’t be as easy as you think! it’s not just about brute force; it’s about 
coordination, strategy, and resilience. can your team conquer the torque and out-pull the compeɵtion? 

| how it works: a 20-meter track will be marked with 2- meter distance checkpoints for easy tracking. 
teams will grip a strong, non-slip rope at a designated start point. once the round begins, the challenge 
is to pull the atv as far as possible within 30 seconds to 1 minute. the distance covered will decide the 
rankings—the team that moves the least distance will be eliminated or ranked lower. with its light yet 
powerful 180kg build, this atv will challenge your teamwork like never before! why it’s exciting: lighter 
than a royal enfield, but tougher to pull than you think! 1. a test of strength, endurance, and 
synchronization! 2. short, high-energy rounds keep the adrenaline pumping! | rules and regulations : 
1. secure setup – the atv and rope are positioned for a controlled, fair challenge. 2. clear markings – 
chalk and cones define safe zones and track progress. 3. quality equipment – a sturdy rope ensures a 
strong yet comfortable grip. 4. ɵme-limited rounds – prevents overexertion and keeps the compeɵtion 
fair. 5. on-site support – safety personnel available for any assistance. contact information: lavkesh 
jaiswal :- +917667094225
